‚ÄúThanks to Netflix for Timothy Chalamet‚Äù: Audience Response to the King
05 Nov 2019, 12:15 by Daria Gromova
The opinion of the Internet was divided.
Netflix released The King based on the historical chronicles of William Shakespeare. The main role of King Henry V was played by Timothy Chalamet, and Robert Pattinson played the Dauphin Louis. Also in this film, Lily-Rose Depp made her debut in her first serious role. Gathered Internet opinions about the new product.







‚ÄúKing‚Äù is brutal, but amazing. Perhaps events are developing too slowly at first, but it more than pays off by the end. Chalame is INCREDIBLE, Edgerton is EXCELLENT and this is clearly my favorite minor role this year. Pattinson's game is also great and eccentric!





Is it worth watching? Yes. Is there a sense of understatement in the film, which went on for almost two and a half hours? Yes too. Just watch it. And thanks to Netflix for making Friday night less lonely. Long live the king!

Expectedly, most of the comments are about Timothy Chalamet.







The incredible acting of Timothy Chalamet is exactly the reason why I will never get tired of watching movies with him. Its highlight is in its sophistication. And I will talk for a long time about this passionate and powerful speech ‚ÄúFor England‚Äù.




Robert Pattinson and Lily-Rose Depp also received their share of fan love.




I watched the ‚ÄúKing‚Äù and I can confidently say that Robert Pattinson can play any character: he can be good, bad, with the strangest accent in the world - and rest assured, he will find a way to do it perfectly. Now it is one of the best actors, and it does not stop developing.





Robert Pattinson is just a movie star, and * that * scene * just killed me.





I don‚Äôt even know what pleased me more in The King - either Robert Pattinson‚Äôs wig, or Robert Pattinson‚Äôs French accent.





Well, I just watched The King, and Lily-Rose Depp is the most beautiful girl I've seen!





You can love her or hate her, but Lily-Rose Depp played excellently in her scene. Her Catherine is more powerful and domineering than Henry, and this is felt. Both performed their roles perfectly.

Of course, the audience could not help but comment on how little Depp was in the frame.




Screen time Lily-Rose Depp in the "King".

Without a negative reaction, too, could not have done.







Either I was in the wrong mood to watch, or the movie was just darn boring. I lasted an hour and 15 minutes, but eventually turned off.
